intro: Helianthella castanea var. cannonae, commonly known as the cannon's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant features.
